column4: I installed ubuntu on 1 partition, then I installed Windows on the other, and it boots straight into Windows, not even asking what I should boot into.
you just need to fix grub
do you have the ubuntu live CD?
do you remember where your root filesystem is?
yea.. installing windows after linux will wipe the MBR
try this: go into windows, start:settings::control panel::
you should be able to set the "bootable flag" for the ubuntu partition
did you find the "bootable" option in disk managment?
it might be under the right-click menu
you should be able to do a grub-install to fix the partition
if you have nothing invested in the ubuntu install
I always install windows first on dual-boot machines
